examples: They waltzed for twenty-one hours and seventeen minutes straight, setting a record.
While waltzing her around the room, he stepped on her toes only once.

definitions.definition: To move briskly and unhesitatingly , especially in an inappropriately casual manner, or when unannounced or uninvited.
examples: He waltzed into the room like he owned the place.
You can't just waltz him in here without documentation!
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , transitive , usually with in , into , around , etc.

definitions.definition: To accomplish a task with little effort .
examples: Don't worry about the interview — you'll waltz it.

main_definition: ( intransitive , transitive ) To dance the waltz (with).
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , transitive , usually with in , into , around , etc. ) To move briskly and unhesitatingly , especially in an inappropriately casual manner, or when unannounced or uninvited.
( informal ) To accomplish a task with little effort .
